name: CSVReadingOptions
desc: A set of CSV file-reading options.

items.name: init(hasHeaderRow: Bool, nilEncodings: Set<String>, trueEncodings: Set<String>, falseEncodings: Set<String>, floatingPointType: CSVType, ignoresEmptyLines: Bool, usesQuoting: Bool, usesEscaping: Bool, delimiter: Character, escapeCharacter: Character)
items.desc: Creates a set of options for reading a CSV file.

items.name: var dateParsers: [(String) -> Date?]
items.desc: An array of closures that parse a date from a string.

items.name: var delimiter: Character
items.desc: The character that separates data fields in a CSV file, typically a comma.

items.name: var escapeCharacter: Character
items.desc: The character that precedes other characters, such as quotation marks, so that the parser interprets them as literal characters instead of special ones.

items.name: var falseEncodings: Set<String>
items.desc: The set of strings that stores acceptable spellings for false Boolean values.

items.name: var floatingPointType: CSVType
items.desc: The type to use for floating-point numeric values.

items.name: var hasHeaderRow: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the CSV file has a header row.

items.name: var ignoresEmptyLines: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether to ignore empty lines.

items.name: var nilEncodings: Set<String>
items.desc: The set of strings that stores acceptable spellings for empty values.

items.name: var trueEncodings: Set<String>
items.desc: The set of strings that stores acceptable spellings for true Boolean values.

items.name: var usesEscaping: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether to enable escaping.

items.name: var usesQuoting: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether to enable quoting.
